page.title: 09SISLEY LEISURE IND.PIVINGTON
page.content: Sisley Leisure Industries are based at Pivington Mill. They make and produce miniature working models of cars for children. At Pivington Mill they assemble all the parts which are made at New Romney. The shell is made from fibre glass and the vehicle is powered by an 8 h.p lawn mower engine. The cars top speed is 25 m.p.h. and a gallon of petrol lasts for 100 miles. The cost of the cars starts at Â£300 for a kit and go to Â£3000 for the top of the range model. Sisley Leisure sell their vehicles to London stores such as Harrods, Hamleys and Selfridges who export to mainly Arab countries. For this reason all the cars are left-hand drive. The models range from go-karts and buggies to Range Rovers.
